frame.name: Used_up
frame.definition:
<def-root>Through use, a <fen>Resource</fen> is diminished in quality or quantity (up to complete attrition) such that it becomes less capable of sustaining future use.
<ex><fex name="res">My entire life savings</fex> <m>is</m> <t>depleted</t> <fex name="exp">due to university and medical bills</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="res">All significant oil and gas reserves</fex> <m>are</m> <t>exhausted</t> or have dwindled to an uneconomical level except for those of the Middle East.</ex>
<ex>Use shampoo and conditioner every day until <fex name="res">the shampoo and conditioner</fex> <m>are</m> <fex name="deg">completely</fex> <t>used up</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Resource
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Resource</fen> is a physical entity or an ability to perform work that was used in an earlier process, typically in pursuit of a goal.
<ex><fex name="res">The battery</fex> <m>is</m> slightly <t>worn out</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>A measure of the amount of the <fen>Resource</fen> that is gone, or of the degree to which its quality is reduced.
<ex>Don't put the battery on a charger until it is <fex name="deg">totally</fex> <t>spent</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root> The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes an event or state from whose occurrence the <fen>Resource</fen>'s being used up logically follows.
<ex>Others say that the Canadian marketing talent pool is <t>depleted</t> <fex name="exp">because fewer young people are being attracted to the business</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Excess
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates that the presence of an overwhelming amount of a kind of entity or the high intensity of an event is sufficient to bring about the used up state of the <fen>Resource</fen>.
<ex>Rent it for nostalgia, but I don't recommend buying it unless you own the video and it is <t>worn out</t> <fex name="Excess">with so much use</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root> <fen>Subregion</fen> denotes a sub-part of the <fen>Resource</fen> in which the it is specifically exhausted or worn out.
<ex>Sometimes if you have a shoe and it is <t>worn out</t> <fex name="sub">on one side</fex> you'll see that if you put your foot in it, it leans in that direction.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: worn out.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having all ones resources exhausted

lexUnit.name: depleted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being reduced in number or quantity

lexUnit.name: exhausted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of resources or reserves) used up completely.

lexUnit.name: through.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having finished an activity, relationship, etc.
